title: Fleetwood Mac and Led Zeppelin are not headlining Glastonbury 2020
text:
Bookies fave include Sir Paul McCartney, Taylor Swift and Fleetwood Mac (Picture: Getty Images)

Fleetwood Mac is said to have ‘turned down’ a headline slot at Glastonbury Festival’s 50th anniversary celebration over money.

The festival has yet to confirm any bands for 2020 but the bookmaker’s favourites included Sir Paul McCartney, Taylor Swift and iconic 70s band Fleetwood Mac.

It is thought Fleetwood Mac has been approached several times by Michael and Emily Eavis but speaking at the Cheltenham Literature Festival, Emily confirmed Fleetwood Mac will not be performing in 2020 – and neither will Led Zeppelin.

‘They are a band I’d love to have at Glastonbury,’ she said of the Go Your Own Way singers.

‘I’ve always been quite open about the fact that we would really love to have them. I’m so hopeful that one day they will do it. But it’s not going to happen for 2020, forget it. I’m sorry.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘The other one is Led Zeppelin. People keep coming up to me again and saying “Is it true?” Let’s clear that up now. I do not think that is going to happen.’

Fleetwood Mac found fame in the 1970s (Picture: Getty Images)

After a sell-out world tour in 2019, sources close to the band have claimed that several members of the group did not believe the money on the table from the festival was ‘worthwhile’.

‘Michael is a huge fan and really, really wanted to make it work. He knew getting them on board for the 50th anniversary would be extra special and conversations were positive,’ a source close to the festival alleged.

Speaking to The Sun, the insider added: ‘But ultimately, while Mick Fleetwood was up for it with the money on offer, other members didn’t feel it was worthwhile.’

Glastonbury’s 50th anniversary festival will take place at Worthy Farm from 24-28 June 2020.

The first batch of tickets for the festival, which included coach travel to the event, sold out in less than half an hour before the general admission tickets went on sale on Sunday morning.

Glastonbury’s 50th anniversary festival will take place from 24-28 June 2020 (Picture: Getty)

While the festival may be turning 50 in 2020, it only took place intermittently throughout the 70s before becoming an annual event in 1981.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Since then it has taken place most years although it takes a break every few years to allow the ground to recover from being trampled on by all those revellers.

Will Taylor Swift hit the Pyramid Stage? (Picture: Getty)

In September Taylor released tour dates for her seventh album Lover tour – and there was a conveniently empty spot for both the Saturday and Sunday of Glastonbury Festival 2020.

The Shake It Off singer revealed dates for 2020 and shared with fans that she will be performing across various festivals, some of which she has curated herself.

‘The Lover album is open fields, sunsets, + SUMMER. I want to perform it in a way that feels authentic. I want to go to some places I haven’t been and play festivals. Where we didn’t have festivals, we made some,’ she shared on Twitter, adding: ‘Introducing, Lover Fest East + West!’

There are no UK dates yet but she will play Oslo on 26 June and Denmark on 1 July; Glastonbury 2020 will run 24 – 28 June while other potential dates include London’s BST Festival which in 2019 ran between 5 and 14 July.

In addition to Lover Fest West and Lover Fest East, her only U.S. concert dates in 2020, Taylor announces she will be headlining festivals and concerts in Europe and South America.

Metro.co.uk has contacted reps for Fleetwood Mac for comment.

description: Fleetwood Mac, Taylor Swift and Paul McCartney are bookies favourites for Glastonbury Festival 2020.
